bibl.title: Moses Keokuk v. Albert Wiley. Syllabus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
Albert Wiley
v
Keokuck. }
Error from Douglas County
Affirmed

1 A person who had served as a talesman in the trial of a cause at the same term of the court was placed on the regular panel in place of a prior excused. He was challenged by defendant because of his having once serv previous service as talesman. The court remanded the challenge, and he was then challenged peremptorily held. That the court used in overuling the challengers, but in as much as the record does not show that the defendant exhausted his peremptory challenges a new trial will not be ordered for reversed for an error which was caused by the action of the defendant.
2) It is not error to charge that an illegal act has been committed by the defendant, when the answer of defendant admits facts that show he did certain acts which must be held illegal

3 It is not error to charge the jury that they are authorized to give exemplary damages where the elements of fraud, malice, gross negligence, or oppression mingle in and form
part of the cause of action.
